title: The AT&T Mail Gateway
historical_context: This article discusses the early methods of email communication between AT&T Mail and the Internet, highlighting the transition from traditional mail systems to digital communication.
target_audience: Hackers, network engineers, email system administrators, and anyone interested in the history of email protocols.
short_summary: The article explains how to send and receive emails between AT&T Mail and the Internet, detailing the addressing formats and restrictions involved in using the AT&T Mail Gateway.
summary: The article further elaborates on the restrictions imposed on the use of the Internet Gateway, particularly regarding commercial traffic and surcharged services. Alien notes that users are prohibited from using the gateway for commercial messaging, advertising, or soliciting, which reflects the early attempts to regulate email usage in a burgeoning digital landscape. By providing practical examples and clear guidelines, this article serves as a valuable resource for understanding the complexities of email communication during a pivotal time in the evolution of digital correspondence.
